skill.name: brenda-database
skill.description: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equations, organism data, and substrate-specific enzyme information for biochemical research and metabolic pathway analysis.
skill.summary: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equatio...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes Python scripts that access the BRENDA SOAP API and can write outputs such as exports and plots. Network use and credential-based access are expected for the stated purpose. No obfuscation, persistence mechanisms, or external command execution were found in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable enzyme kinetics and reaction data is slow and fragmented. This skill queries BRENDA and structures results for analysis and reporting.
actual_capabilities: Query Km and reaction data through BRENDA SOAP calls
Parse BRENDA entries into structured fields
Search enzymes by substrate or product
Export kinetic data to CSV, JSON, or Excel
limitations: Requires valid BRENDA credentials and the external brenda_client module
Needs network access to the BRENDA SOAP API endpoint
Plotting and exports require optional libraries such as pandas and matplotlib
Results depend on BRENDA coverage and rate limits

use_cases.title: Retrieve kinetic constants
use_cases.description: Fetch Km data for a target EC number and summarize conditions by organism.

use_cases.title: Design enzyme pathways
use_cases.description: Draft a multi step pathway and generate a feasibility report.

use_cases.title: Create enzyme visuals
use_cases.description: Generate plots for kinetic distributions and substrate specificity.

prompt_templates.title: Get Km values
prompt_templates.prompt: Get Km values for EC 1.1.1.1 and list organism, substrate, and Km value.

prompt_templates.title: Compare organisms
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare alcohol dehydrogenase Km values across Escherichia coli, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, and Homo sapiens.

prompt_templates.title: Export kinetics
prompt_templates.prompt: Export kinetic data for EC 2.7.1.1 to CSV and report how many entries were exported.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway report
prompt_templates.prompt: Find a pathway for lactate with up to 3 steps and generate a pathway report file.

output_examples.input: Find Km data for EC 1.1.1.1 in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
output: Found 12 Km entries for EC 1.1.1.1 in Saccharomyces cerevisiae
Lowest Km observed: 0.08 mM for ethanol
Typical conditions: pH 7.0 to 7.5, 25 to 30 C

best_practices: Use specific EC numbers and organism filters to reduce noise
Add delays between requests to respect BRENDA rate limits
Cache results locally when repeating queries
anti_patterns: Sending broad wildcard queries in tight loops
Running exports without confirming dependencies are installed
Assuming missing data means the enzyme does not exist

faq.question: What platforms does this support?
faq.answer: It runs on systems that can execute Python scripts and reach the BRENDA SOAP API.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Yes, BRENDA enforces rate limits and account quotas.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, functions return structured data and can export CSV or JSON.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere else?
faq.answer: Requests go only to the BRENDA SOAP endpoint using your credentials.

faq.question: What if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Verify BRENDA_EMAIL and BRENDA_PASSWORD and confirm your API access.

faq.question: How does this compare to web scraping?
faq.answer: It uses the official SOAP API, which is more stable and structured.
